scone.console.window

All functions here give some sort of direct access to the . However, I suggest you use the 
class Frame
(-work, haha). If you decide that you must use these functions separately, they must be initialized with 
openWindow()


For those who want to steal code, each function in here calls a win_*. (Eg. setCursor(x,y) calles win_setCursor(x,y) on Windows)

auto writeSlot(size_t x, size_t y, ref Slot slot);
Writes out a slot at (x, y)

Params:
size_t x The x position to write to
size_t y The y position to write to
Slot slot The slot which will be written

auto setCursor(size_t x, size_t y);
Set the cursor position

@property auto title(string title);
Set the title

@property auto cursorVisible(bool visible);
Set cursor visible.

@property auto lineWrapping(bool lw);
Set line wrapping.

@property auto windowSize();
Get the window size

Returns:
int[2], where [0] = w, [1] = h
